meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to absorb or soak up liquid or energy.
meanings.sent1: The sponge's absorptivity was impressive as it soaked up all the spilled water.
meanings.sent2: The paper towel's high absorptivity made it perfect for cleaning up the mess.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape had such incredible absorptivity that it could absorb any liquid thrown at it.
meanings.sent4: Her mind had an absorptivity for knowledge that was unmatched by anyone in the class.
meanings.sent5: The desert sand's absorptivity of heat made it scorching to walk on during the day.

meanings.definition: The measure of how well a material absorbs radiation or sound.
meanings.sent1: The scientist calculated the absorptivity of the new material to determine its effectiveness in blocking radiation.
meanings.sent2: The soundproofing foam's high absorptivity made it ideal for recording studios.
meanings.sent3: The alien spaceship had an absorptivity for Earth's radio signals, causing interference with communication.
meanings.sent4: The absorptivity of the black hole was so strong that not even light could escape its grasp.
meanings.sent5: The absorptivity of the ocean depths created an eerie silence that enveloped the submarine.
